entities.name: SOVIET UNION
entities.description: The Soviet Union was a key player in the early days of space exploration, launching the first artificial satellite, Sputnik 1, in 1957, and sending the first human, Yuri Gagarin, into orbit in 1961

entities.name: UNITED STATES
entities.description: The United States was a major competitor in the space race, achieving significant milestones such as the Apollo 11 moon landing in 1969

entities.name: SPUTNIK 1
entities.description: Sputnik 1 was the first artificial satellite launched by the Soviet Union in 1957, marking the beginning of the space race

entities.name: YURI GAGARIN
entities.description: Yuri Gagarin was the first human to orbit the Earth, achieving this milestone in 1961 as part of the Soviet space program

entities.name: NEIL ARMSTRONG
entities.description: Neil Armstrong was one of the first humans to walk on the moon as part of the Apollo 11 mission in 1969

entities.name: BUZZ ALDRIN
entities.description: Buzz Aldrin was one of the first humans to walk on the moon as part of the Apollo 11 mission in 1969

entities.name: APOLLO 11
entities.description: The Apollo 11 mission, launched by the United States in 1969, was the first to land humans on the moon

entities.name: VOYAGER MISSIONS
entities.description: The Voyager missions, launched in the 1970s, were a series of space probes sent to study the outer planets of our solar system

entities.name: MARS ROVERS
entities.description: Mars rovers, such as Spirit, Opportunity, and Curiosity, have been sent to explore the surface of Mars and conduct scientific research

entities.name: INTERNATIONAL SPACE STATION (ISS)
entities.description: The International Space Station is a collaborative project involving multiple countries, serving as a platform for conducting experiments in microgravity and testing technologies for future space missions

entities.name: SPACEX
entities.description: SpaceX is a private company founded by Elon Musk, known for developing reusable rockets and aiming to reduce the cost of space travel

entities.name: NASA
entities.description: NASA is the United States' space agency, responsible for the country's civilian space program and aeronautics and space research, including the Perseverance rover mission to Mars

entities.name: PERSEVERANCE ROVER
entities.description: The Perseverance rover, launched by NASA, landed on Mars in February 2021 and is conducting experiments to search for signs of past life on the red planet

entities.name: BLUE ORIGIN
entities.description: Blue Origin is a private spaceflight company founded by Jeff Bezos, focusing on suborbital space tourism and reusable rocket technology

entities.name: VIRGIN GALACTIC
entities.description: Virgin Galactic is a private spaceflight company founded by Richard Branson, offering suborbital spaceflights to private individuals

entities.name: OPPORTUNITY
entities.description: Opportunity was one of the Mars rovers sent by NASA to explore the surface of Mars

entities.name: CURIOSITY
entities.description: Curiosity is a Mars rover sent by NASA to explore the surface of Mars, conducting scientific research and sending back valuable data

entities.name: JUPITER
entities.description: Jupiter is one of the outer planets in our solar system, a focus of future space exploration missions

entities.name: SATURN
entities.description: Saturn is one of the outer planets in our solar system, a focus of future space exploration missions

entities.name: EXOPLANETS
entities.description: Exoplanets are planets outside our solar system, a key focus of future space missions to search for signs of extraterrestrial life

entities.name: ION PROPULSION SYSTEMS
entities.description: Ion propulsion systems are advanced technologies being developed to enable spacecraft to travel faster and farther than ever before

entities.name: ADVANCED MATERIALS
entities.description: Advanced materials are being developed to enhance the capabilities of spacecraft, making them more durable and efficient
